keyMoments.title: Debuts Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer
keyMoments.description: While tied up, Luffy debuts his Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer technique, wrapping his legs around Vander Decken IX and smashing him into the ground headfirst.
keyMoments.significance: First use of a new Gear Second technique, demonstrating Luffy's post-timeskip combat creativity and ability to fight even while restrained.

keyMoments.title: Strikes Wadatsumi with Jet Pistol
keyMoments.description: Luffy counters Wadatsumi's attack before the giant fish-man can strike, hitting him with a Gomu Gomu no Jet Pistol that breaks one of his teeth.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's superior speed and combat awareness in protecting his group during their escape.

abilities.description: A Gear Second technique where Luffy wraps his legs around his opponent at extreme speed and smashes them into the ground.

keyMoments.title: Rejects Vander Decken's Marriage Proposal
keyMoments.description: Shirahoshi firmly but politely rejects Vander Decken IX's marriage proposal, telling him he is 'not her type,' despite his threats to kill her if she refuses.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Shirahoshi's growing courage and willingness to stand up for herself, choosing honesty over self-preservation. This rejection triggers Decken's murderous rage.
keyMoments.quote: I'm sorry, but... you're not my type.

keyMoments.title: Escapes to the Sea Forest
keyMoments.description: With Luffy's help, Shirahoshi escapes on her pet shark Megalo, heading to the Sea Forest where she will meet Jinbe and learn about her mother's legacy.
keyMoments.significance: First time Shirahoshi has left Hard-Shell Tower and is now actively fleeing from Vander Decken, marking a major step in her character development from fearful to courageous.

relationships.description: Vander Decken IX has obsessively pursued Shirahoshi for ten years, threatening her with deadly objects. His 'love' is revealed to be possessive obsession that turns to murderous intent upon rejection.

evolutionMoments.description: Shirahoshi rejects Decken's marriage proposal, solidifying their relationship as antagonistic rather than any romantic possibility.

relationships.description: Shirahoshi trusts Luffy to protect her and helps him escape despite the danger to herself.

evolutionMoments.description: Shirahoshi demonstrates complete trust in Luffy by escaping with him despite the local fish-men's accusations.

reveals.information: Vander Decken has pursued her for ten years since she was six years old

name.japanese: バンダー・デッケン九世

keyMoments.title: First Direct Confrontation with Shirahoshi
keyMoments.description: Vander Decken IX appears before Shirahoshi in person for the first time, directly confronting her after years of threatening her from afar.
keyMoments.significance: Escalates the conflict from distant threats to direct confrontation, bringing Decken's obsession to a critical point.

keyMoments.title: Marriage Proposal and Rejection
keyMoments.description: Vander Decken proposes marriage to Shirahoshi, claiming she'll escape death if she accepts. When she rejects him, he becomes enraged and declares her existence an eyesore.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the twisted nature of Decken's 'love' - it's possessive obsession that transforms into murderous intent when rejected.
keyMoments.quote: I've had feelings for you for the past ten years, and you stepped all over them! Your existence is now an eyesore!

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Luffy's Jet Hammer
keyMoments.description: Vander Decken is defeated by Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer technique, being smashed headfirst into the ground.
keyMoments.significance: First major defeat for Decken, though he will recover and continue his pursuit later in the arc.

relationships.description: Obsessively pursued Shirahoshi for ten years, claiming to love her but willing to kill her if she won't marry him.

evolutionMoments.description: Proposes marriage to Shirahoshi and is rejected, causing him to decide to kill her instead.

reveals.information: His 'love' for Shirahoshi is possessive obsession that turns to murder when rejected
Has had feelings for Shirahoshi for ten years

keyMoments.title: Petrifies Upon Seeing Shirahoshi
keyMoments.description: Despite Chopper's desperate warnings, Sanji turns to look at Princess Shirahoshi and is instantly petrified by her overwhelming beauty.
keyMoments.significance: A comedic moment that demonstrates Sanji's extreme reaction to beautiful women while also establishing Shirahoshi's legendary beauty.

keyMoments.title: Struck by Luffy's Jet Pistol
keyMoments.description: The giant pufferfish fish-man Wadatsumi attempts to stop the Straw Hats' escape but is struck first by Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Jet Pistol, which breaks one of his teeth.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the vast difference in combat ability between Luffy and Wadatsumi despite Wadatsumi's enormous size.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Hody Jones with Lion Strike
keyMoments.description: Zoro uses his Shishi Sonson (Lion Strike) technique to seemingly defeat Hody Jones at Ryugu Palace, demonstrating his overwhelming strength even underwater.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Zoro's post-timeskip power by defeating a fish-man captain even in water where fish-men have the advantage.

name.japanese: ホーディ・ジョーンズ

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Zoro's Lion Strike
keyMoments.description: Hody Jones is seemingly defeated by Zoro's Shishi Sonson technique at Ryugu Palace, though he will later return empowered by Energy Steroids.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that without the Energy Steroids, Hody is no match for the post-timeskip Straw Hats, foreshadowing his reliance on the dangerous drugs.

keyMoments.title: Escapes Ryugu Palace with Camie
keyMoments.description: Nami successfully escapes from Ryugu Palace with Camie's help, riding on the mermaid's back with an air bubble. She asks to be taken to the Sea Forest to meet Jinbe.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Nami's emotional confrontation with Jinbe about Arlong, showing her determination to understand the history between fish-men and humans.
keyMoments.quote: Camie, please take me to the Sea Forest. I need to meet Jinbe.

keyMoments.title: Helps Shirahoshi and the Straw Hats Escape
keyMoments.description: Megalo, Shirahoshi's pet shark, carries Shirahoshi, Luffy, Chopper, Hatchan, and Sanji on his back as they escape to the Sea Forest.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Megalo's loyalty to Shirahoshi and his role as her protector and companion.

relationships.description: Megalo is Shirahoshi's beloved pet shark and closest friend, having been her only companion during her years locked in Hard-Shell Tower.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Tries to Prevent Sanji from Seeing Shirahoshi
keyMoments.description: Chopper desperately tries to prevent Sanji from turning around to see Shirahoshi, warning him that he'll die if he does, but Sanji turns around anyway and petrifies.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's concern for his crewmate and his understanding of Sanji's weakness for beautiful women.
keyMoments.quote: Sanji! Don't turn around! You'll die if you see her!

keyMoments.title: Helps Nami Escape to the Sea Forest
keyMoments.description: Camie helps Nami escape from Ryugu Palace by carrying her on her back with an air bubble, taking her to the Sea Forest to meet Jinbe.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Camie's loyalty to the Straw Hats and her willingness to help them despite the danger.

keyMoments.title: Recognizes the Energy Steroids Threat
keyMoments.description: King Neptune demonstrates concern for his people by recognizing that the Energy Steroids could be a real threat to Fish-Man Island's safety.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Neptune's wisdom as a ruler and foreshadows the devastating effects the Energy Steroids will have on Hody Jones and his crew.
